body:
### Describe the bug

Not sure if it's a desired behavior, but with v3.0.0b3, the `__module__` attribute can't be overwritten in cython classes.

When declared, it sees it as a re-declaration, but when not included, it can't be set.

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```cython
cdef class wrapper:
    cdef public str __doc__
    cdef public str __module__
    
    def __init__(self, base):
        self.__doc__ = base.__doc__
        self.__module__ = base.__module__
```
```
Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...

cdef class wrapper:
    cdef public str __doc__
    cdef public str __module__
                    ^
------------------------------------------------------------

/home/eric/.cache/ipython/cython/_cython_magic_4cdcf791beab0223ccf5106b2849f4661c642c31.pyx:4:20: '__module__' redeclared 

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...

cdef class wrapper:
    cdef public str __doc__
    cdef public str __module__
         ^
------------------------------------------------------------

/home/eric/.cache/ipython/cython/_cython_magic_4cdcf791beab0223ccf5106b2849f4661c642c31.pyx:4:9: Compiler crash in AnalyseDeclarationsTransform

File 'ModuleNode.py', line 203, in analyse_declarations: ModuleNode(_cython_magic_4cdcf791beab0223ccf5106b2849f4661c642c31.pyx:2:0,
    full_module_name = '_cython_magic_4cdcf791beab0223ccf5106b2849f4661c642c31')
File 'Nodes.py', line 393, in analyse_declarations: StatListNode(_cython_magic_4cdcf791beab0223ccf5106b2849f4661c642c31.pyx:2:5)
File 'Nodes.py', line 5425, in analyse_declarations: CClassDefNode(_cython_magic_4cdcf791beab0223ccf5106b2849f4661c642c31.pyx:2:5,
    as_name = 'wrapper',
    class_name = 'wrapper',
    module_name = '',
    punycode_class_name = 'wrapper',
    visibility = 'private')
File 'Nodes.py', line 393, in analyse_declarations: StatListNode(_cython_magic_4cdcf791beab0223ccf5106b2849f4661c642c31.pyx:3:4)
File 'Nodes.py', line 1529, in analyse_declarations: CVarDefNode(_cython_magic_4cdcf791beab0223ccf5106b2849f4661c642c31.pyx:4:9,
    modifiers = [...]/0,
    visibility = 'public')

Compiler crash traceback from this point on:
  File "/home/eric/miniconda3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/Cython/Compiler/Nodes.py", line 1529, in analyse_declarations
    self.entry = dest_scope.declare_var(
  File "/home/eric/miniconda3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/Cython/Compiler/Symtab.py", line 2386, in declare_var
    entry = self.declare(name, cname, type, pos, visibility)
  File "/home/eric/miniconda3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/Cython/Compiler/Symtab.py", line 548, in declare
    entries[name].already_declared_here()
  File "/home/eric/miniconda3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/Cython/Compiler/Symtab.py", line 260, in already_declared_here
    error(self.pos, "Previous declaration is here")
  File "/home/eric/miniconda3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/Cython/Compiler/Errors.py", line 178, in error
    raise InternalError(message)
InternalError: Internal compiler error: Previous declaration is here
```
```cython
cdef class wrapper:
    cdef public str __doc__
    
    def __init__(self, base):
        self.__doc__ = base.__doc__
        self.__module__ = base.__module__
```
```
AttributeError: '_cython_magic_d09bc6b870dd436c674d9ae08690f43581f29090.wrapper' object has no attribute '__module__'
```



### Expected behaviour

I expect to be able to set `__module__`.

### OS

Linux

### Python version

3.10.0

### Cython version

3.0.0b3

### Additional context

_No response_

comment_data.body:
Thanks for the report. Probably to do with https://github.com/cython/cython/commit/8d974dcebc92a54747afd8f271ac734b829c019f.

I suspect we do want to fix it, but it may not be high priority enough for the 3.0 release (depending on how quick that ends up being)

rename.to: [BUG] __module__ attribute can't be set manually in cdef classes

title: [BUG] __module__ attribute can't be set manually in cdef classes
